chart.title: Mean lead concentrations in the blood of adults
chart.subtitle: Mean lead concentrations in the blood of adults aged 14 and over between 2010 and 2019. There is no defined 'safe' level for lead blood concentrations. The WHO adopts a threshold of 5 µg/dL as an achievable maximum level.
chart.citation: Ericson et al. (2021). Blood lead levels in low-income and middle-income countries: a systematic review. The Lancet Planetary Health.
